article_text:
President Obama’s plan to reform retirement savings could more than double the cost of investment advice for many savers. That’s why Democrats on Capitol Hill are now demanding a rewrite and even Hillary Clinton still hasn’t endorsed it. Meanwhile, Mr. Obama is helping state governments compete against the private financial advisers his rule punishes.

The ostensible pitch for the Labor Department’s rule is that when savers are rolling over money from a 401(k) retirement plan into an Individual Retirement Account, they...

twitter.description: Bipartisan opposition builds to Labor’s new fiduciary rule for retirement saving, says an editorial in the Wall Street Journal.
twitter.title: Democrats Against ObamaSave
